UI_visible_response: Read 13 web pagesView Page DetailsDuring the Long March, the Chinese Red Army suffered significant losses. Of the approximately 100,000 troops who began the retreat from the Jiangxi Soviet and other bases, only about 8,000 ultimately survived. The First Front Red Army, which started with around 86,000 troops, had only 36,000 left by the time it crossed the Xiang River. traffic_visible_response: During the Long March, the Chinese Red Army suffered significant losses. Of the approximately 100,000 troops who began the retreat from the Jiangxi Soviet and other bases, only about 8,000 ultimately survived[^1^]. The First Front Red Army, which started with around 86,000 troops, had only 36,000 left by the time it crossed the Xiang River[^1^]. Throughout the entire Long March, the communists suffered between 150,000 and 170,000 casualties and defections[^5^].
